text: Sumesh Achuthan (born 5 October 1975) is an Indian politician from Palakkad Kerala. He currently serves as the State Chairman of Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee(KPCC) OBC Department and Vice President of Indian National Congress Palakkad DCC ==Political career== Sumesh Achuthan started his political career in his school days through Kerala Students Union, the student wing of Indian National Congress. During the earlier years of his political career, he held various positions such as Vice President of Youth Congress Committee Palakkad and followed by Palakkad District President of Indian Youth Congress, and now, Vice President of Palakkad District Congress Committee. In June 2017 Sumesh Achuthan led the `Panthibhojanam' with residents of Ambedkar colony, Govindapuram in Muthalamada for the accusing the Hindus of the neighborhood of practicing untouchability against the Chakkliyar community. Thrithala MLA V. T. Balram said it was only after visiting the colony with Indian National Congress leader Sumesh Achuthan, that i came to know about the gravity of the issue. In July 2017, he asked to increase compensation for the loss of agricultural crops due to attack by wild animals, from INR 770 per coconut tree to INR 10,000 and INR 30,000 for rice crop. He asked the government to consider an insurance package for people affected by the attack In September 2018 Sumesh Achuthan talked about the complaint from the DYFI woman leader who had complained to the Mannarkkad Circle Inspector against Communist Party of India (Marxist)(CPIM) legislator P. K. Sasi against for the sexual harassment, the party later suspended him for six months over the complaint of sexual harassment filed against him. In 2018, Rahul Gandhi appointed Sumesh Achuthan as the State Chairman of Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee(KPCC), Other Backward Communities (OBC) Department. ==Positions== Sumesh Achuthan has held the following positions: * Indian Youth Congress(IYC): District Vice President, Palakkad from 2004–2008 * Indian Youth Congress(IYC): District President, Palakkad from 2008–2010 * Indian National Congress(INC): District Vice President, Palakkad from 2015–present * Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee(KPCC): OBC Department State Chairman from 2018-present * Chief Patron of Indian National Differentially Abled Congress from 2009-present * President of Palakkad Football Association from 2012-present * President of Mahatma Gandhi Environmental Protection and Better Living Cooperative Society from 2015-present ==References== Category:Indian National Congress politicians from Kerala Category:Living people Category:People from Palakkad district Category:1975 births
